notesStmt.note: Water damage and mould at foot throughout. Some tidemarks. Foxing in all margins. Some old infills at ends. Slight worming. Ink variable in colour, some entirely washed away.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 327: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum: inscribed, [106v].
